tips.text: Crusty bread, fresh olive oil, olives and glass of wine.
The Village Voice voted this Best Cocktail Trend in our Best Of New York Poll!
Come over for cheap, top quality coffee and Italian sandwiches. Get the caffe macchiato for $1.50 & prosciutto panini w/ mixed greens for $8.
wait next door at Von and they'll come get you, can even bring your drink with you.
One of the most eagerly-awaited downtown openings of the year is Sara Jenkins’ latest, where she’ll augment her porchetta with homey dishes like lasagna al forno. Featured in Where to Eat 2011!

formattedAddress: 53 Great Jones St (btwn Lafayette St. & Bowery)

tips.text: In the morning, a casual cafe offering light breakfast dishes. In the middle of the day, an Italian delicatessen. And at night, a bustling bar and dining room serving a menu of rustic Italian fare.
possibly my FAVORITE porchetta sandwich in the world
It's all about the downstairs
A fancy meal and killer desserts. I love the apple cider doughnuts. -Eric Wolitzky, Top Chef Just Desserts
Where we go for our Nutella calzone fix. Never heard of it? TRY IT. It's also a perfect spot to enjoy a cocktail after work -- just be careful the wax from the giant candles doesn't ruin your drink!
Described as “last meal”-worthy, it’s the perfect place to take your confessor to show your appreciation for his dexterity with a cheese cutter. Quoted from Zagat.
Cute Italian waiter ;)
ℹ Look around and learn more about Bar 89, Bar Primi and New York in the travel guide "SoHo: From Balthazar to Boutiques" with Tales & Tours for your smartphone (offline maps too)

The pastas are definitely the focal point of Thompson's newest & trendiest spot. The gnocchi, agnolotti w/ sweetbreads & seafood linguini are outstanding. Pay with Cover at skip waiting for the check!
The namesake dish is presented in a HUGE Parmesan wheel, tossed around hot so that it soaks up the cheese, and is then put on your plate. So good.
One of the best kept secrets in New York. Brunch, coffee, mimosa for $13.50 and rarely a line. Order the green eggs and polenta.
Yummy millefoglie and italian cheesecake!!
According to community contributor James Traub, "The basil-and-gelato re-imagination of the capresecould serve as Giano’s signature dish."
this 'candle' was started to celebrate the end of prohibition!
Pizza is what you'll find at Michaels White's latest spot in the East Village. Palermitana-style crust stacked with combos like the maialona.There’s also a house lasagna and a rotating daily special,

items.finePrint: Valid with a purchase of $25 or more.
items.title: Special

tips.text: 25 years open in NYC is no small feat - so celebrate with Cucina Di Pesce Sept. 10-13: get a $25 VIP anniversary party ticket including food & 2 cocktails in the Voice Daily Deal: http://ow.ly/du0r2
Best Italian coffee place!

items.message: Free soda with any slice purchase when you check-in. Show check-in at the register.
items.title: Special

tips.text: The ultimate spot that marries artichoke dip with pizza to make one of the most savory slices around. Regulars call ahead for pick up to save themselves from the insanely long lines.
Excellent food and décor
There are only five pizzas worth eating in New York & Luzzo’s is amongst them. Nothing beats their standard gooey margarita pie. - Soraya
